definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Rhett bought his daughter a pony to ride on.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德给他的女儿买了一匹小马来骑。

sentences.english: Scott led by people with a pony and Amundsen led equipped with the dogs and ski.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特率领的人与小马和亚孟森领导配备警犬和滑雪。

sentences.english: I combed my hair with my hair brush and made it into a pony.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的梳子梳头并把头发弄成小马辫。

sentences.english: The ponys coat looked orangish yellow, and the ponys tail had no hair.
sentences.chinese: 小马身上的毛泛着橘黄色，尾巴上一根毛都没有。

sentences.english: But the pony simply has very short legs.
sentences.chinese: 结果却是小马只是腿短而已。

sentences.english: Also, who is smart like seismograph, omnipotent spy Xiao Ma.
sentences.chinese: 还有，一个如地震仪般机灵，又无所不能的特务小马。

sentences.english: Traveling in China is chiefly done by sedan chair, sometimes by donkey or pony.
sentences.chinese: 在中国旅行主要是坐轿子，有时候骑驴或小马。

sentences.english: Reds boss Roy Hodgson is considering Melo as a direct replacement for want-away defensive midfielder Javier Mascherano.
sentences.chinese: 老霍考虑把梅洛作为想走的后腰小马的直接替代者。

sentences.english: One day, a colt took a bag of wheat to the mill.
sentences.chinese: 一天，小马驮着麦子去磨坊。

sentences.english: And she followed him into the kitchen like a pony on high heels.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他来到厨房，像匹踩着高跷的小马。

sentences.english: Min Min had done her best but the green pony was just ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 敏敏已经尽力了，绿衣小马还是在它的前面。

sentences.english: The mare gave birth to a colt.
The thief slipped away down a side street.
sentences.chinese: 小偷阒然从一条小马路溜走了。

sentences.english: Tell him to catch the ponies and saddle up.
sentences.chinese: 叫他牵住小马并套上马鞍。

sentences.english: One of the farmers owned a mare that had foaled in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个农夫拥有的一匹母马，在市场诞下了小马。

definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
older male cousin via female line
(slang) novice/greenhorn/fool/idiot/abbr. for 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3], pretty boy
